verses.verse: Boast<WH1984> not yourself of to morrow<WH4279>; for you know<WH3045> not what a day<WH3117> may bring forth<WH3205>.
Let another man<WH2114> praise<WH1984> you<WH6310>, and not your own mouth; a stranger<WH5237>, and not your own lips<WH8193>.
A stone<WH68> is heavy<WH3514>, and the sand<WH2344> weighty<WH5192>; but a fool<WH191>'s wrath<WH3708> is heavier<WH3515> than them both<WH8147>.
Wrath<WH2534> is cruel<WH395>, and anger<WH639> is outrageous<WH7858>; but who is able to stand<WH5975> before<WH6440> envy<WH7068>?
Open<WH1540> rebuke<WH8433> is better<WH2896> than secret<WH5641> love<WH160>.
Faithful<WH539> are the wounds<WH6482> of a friend<WH157>; but the kisses<WH5390> of a enemy<WH8130> are deceitful<WH6280>.
The full<WH7649> soul<WH5315> loathes<WH947> a honeycomb<WH5317>; but to the hungry<WH7457> soul<WH5315> every bitter thing<WH4751> is sweet<WH4966>.
As a bird<WH6833> that wanders<WH5074> from her nest<WH7064>, so is a man<WH376> that wanders<WH5074> from his place<WH4725>.
Ointment<WH8081> and perfume<WH7004> rejoice<WH8055> the heart<WH3820>: so does the sweetness<WH4986> of a man<WH7453>'s friend by hearty<WH5315> counsel<WH6098>.

Your own friend<WH7453>, and your father<WH1>'s friend<WH7453>, forsake<WH5800> not<WH935>; neither go into your brother<WH251>'s house<WH1004> in the day<WH3117> of your calamity<WH343>: for better<WH2896> is a neighbor<WH7934> that is near<WH7138> than a brother<WH251> far off<WH7350>.
My son<WH1121>, be wise<WH2449>, and make my heart<WH3820> glad<WH8055>, that I may answer<WH7725> him that blasphemes me<WH2778>.
A prudent<WH6175> man foresees<WH7200> the evil<WH7451>, and hides<WH5641> himself<WH6612>; but the simple pass on<WH5674>, and are punished<WH6064>.
Take<WH3947> his garment<WH899> that is collateral<WH6148> for a stranger<WH2114>, and take a pledge<WH2254> of him for a strange woman<WH5237>.
He that blesses<WH1288> his friend<WH7453> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>, rising early<WH7925> in the morning<WH1242>, it shall be counted<WH2803> a curse to him<WH7045>.
A continual<WH2956> dropping<WH1812> in a very rainy<WH5464> day<WH3117> and a contentious<WH4079> woman<WH802> are alike<WH7737>.
Whoever hides<WH6845> her hides<WH6845> the wind<WH7307>, and the ointment<WH8081> of his right hand<WH3225>, which betrays itself<WH7121>.
Iron<WH1270> sharpens<WH2300> iron<WH1270>; so a man<WH376> sharpens<WH2300> the favor<WH6440> of his friend<WH7453>.
Whoever keeps<WH5341> the fig tree<WH8384> shall eat<WH398> the fruit<WH6529> there<WH8104>: so he that waits on his master<WH113> shall be honored<WH3513>.
As in water<WH4325> face<WH6440> answers to face<WH6440>, so the heart<WH3820> of man<WH120> to man<WH120>.
Hell<WH7585> and destruction<WH11> are never<WH3808> full<WH7646>; so the eyes<WH5869> of man<WH120> are never satisfied<WH7646>.
As the refining pot<WH4715> for silver<WH3701>, and the furnace<WH3564> for gold<WH2091>; so is a man<WH376> to<WH6310> his praise<WH4110>.
Though you should pound<WH3806> a fool<WH191> in a mortar<WH4388> among<WH8432> wheat<WH7383> with a pestle<WH5940>, yet will not his foolishness<WH200> depart from him<WH5493>.
Be you diligent<WH3045> to know<WH3045> the state<WH6440> of your flocks<WH6629>, and look<WH7896> well<WH3820> to your herds<WH5739>.
For riches<WH2633> are not for ever<WH5769>: and does the crown<WH5145> endure to every<WH1755> generation<WH1755>?
The hay<WH2682> appears<WH1540>, and the tender grass<WH1877> shows<WH7200> itself<WH6212>, and herbs of the mountains<WH2022> are gathered<WH622>.
The lambs<WH3532> are for your clothing<WH3830>, and the goats<WH6260> are the price<WH4242> of the field<WH7704>.
And you shall have goats<WH5795>' milk<WH2461> enough<WH1767> for your food<WH3899>, for the food<WH3899> of your household<WH1004>, and for the maintenance<WH2416> for your maidens<WH5291>.
